div.p: STEP, in a ſhip, a block of wood fixed on the decks or bottom of a ſhip, and having a hole in its upper side, fitted to receive the heel of a maſt or capſtern. The steps of the main and foremaſts of every ſhip reſt upon the kelſon, to which they are firmly ſecured by knees, bolts, or ſpike-nails. The ſtep of the mizen-maſt uſually reſts upon the lower deck.
